definition: to store/to save/to have in reserve/heir/Taiwan pr. [chu2]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: So how can we not be concerned about the reserves during the transition period?
sentences.chinese: 过渡时期我们不过问储备金行吗？

sentences.english: In case of a shortage of reserves, the people's government of the pooling region shall advance the payment.
sentences.chinese: 储备金不足支付的，由统筹地区的人民政府垫付。

sentences.english: They're concerned with having too many accidents, which might exhaust their reserves.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心如果事件太多的话，会耗尽他们的储备金。

sentences.english: Excess reserves refer to the part of deposits that surpasses required reserve.
sentences.chinese: 超额储备金指的是超过法定储备的那部分存款。

sentences.english: The banks can keepthe currency as vault cash, which also counts as reserves.
sentences.chinese: 银行将这些货币当作库存现金，同样当作储备金。

sentences.english: They capitalized the company's reserve funds.
sentences.chinese: 他们将公司的储备金移作资本。

definition: to deposit (e.g. in a bank account)
certificate of deposit/time deposit/abbr. for 定期存款|定期存款[ding4 qi1 cun2 kuan3]
to deposit money (in a bank etc)/bank savings/bank deposit
security (property held against a loan)/mortgaged property
